p.s: Description of Enterococcus mundtii sp. nov.
Enterococcus mundtii (mund'ti.i. L. gen. n. mundtii of Mundt; named after the late J. 0. Mundt, an American microbiologist)
Cells are ovoid and occur mostly in pairs or short chains.
The cells are gram positive and nonmotile.
Surface colonies on blood agar or nutrient agar are circular, smooth, and entire.
A yellow pigment is produced.
Nonhemolytic.
Catalase negative.
Growth occurs at 10 and 45°C, in 6.5% NaCl, and at pH 9.6.
Facultatively anaerobic.
L-Lactic acid is the major product of glucose fermentation.

Acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, L-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, D-fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, lactose, maltose, D-mannose, mannitol, melibiose, ribose, salicin, sucrose, trehalose, and D-xylose.
Most strains produce acid from α-methyl-D-mannoside, D-raffinose, and rhamnose; variable results are obtained for glycerol and sorbitol.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, dulcital, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, glycogen, gluconate, inositol, 2-keto-gluconate, 5-keto-gluconate, D-lyxose, melezitose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, α-methyl-xyloside, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, D-turanose, xylitol, or L-xylose.
All strains are Voges-Proskauer positive and hydrolyze esculin; hippurate is not hydrolyzed.
All strains are arginine dehydrolase, β-galactosidase, leucine arylamidase, and pyrolidonylarylamidase positive; most strains are agalactosidase positive.
Alkaline phosphatase negative.
Reacts with Lancefield group D antisera.
Group A type of peptidoglycan based upon lysine (Lys-D-Asp).
The long-chain fatty acids are of the straight-chain saturated, monounsaturated, and cyclopropane ring types (Table 3).
The major fatty acids are hexadecanoic, octadecenoic (Δ11) , and cis-11,12-methylenoctadecanoicacids.
The G +C content of the DNA ranges from 38 to 39 mol%, as determined by the melting temperature method.
The strains form a distinct homology group, as determined by DNA-DNA hybridization.
Isolated from cows, the hands of milkers, plants, and soil.
The type strain is strain NCDO 2375.
Description of the type strain.
In most respects the description of the type strain resembles the description of the species.
The type strain produces acid from glycerol, α-methyl-D-mannoside, sorbitol, rhamnose, and D-raffinose; acid is not produced from amidon or inulin.
The type strain is α-galactosidase positive.
